summary: The document is a classified CIA report from June 28, 1968, detailing a prison break at El Principe Prison in Havana, Cuba, in late April 1968. It describes the escape of prisoners through a tunnel to a neighboring hospital's courtyard, the transfer of ex-Major Rolando Cubela, who was convicted for plotting to assassinate Fidel Castro, and dispels rumors about Huber Matos being among the escapees, confirming he and other political prisoners remained in La Cabana Prison. The report underscores the sensitive nature of the information, relating to national defense and espionage laws.
key_findings: A successful prison break occurred at El Principe Prison in Havana, facilitated by a tunnel leading to a neighboring hospital's courtyard.
Ex-Major Rolando Cubela, convicted for plotting to assassinate Fidel Castro, was transferred following the escape.
Rumors suggesting Huber Matos was among the escapees were incorrect; he and other political prisoners were still detained in La Cabana Prison.
The document is classified, with its contents pertaining to national defense and subject to strict dissemination controls under espionage laws.
